fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32712].
  {panel}

When you have more than 1 favorite dashboards, their names are listed in a sidebar that steels a whole bunch of useful space from your dashboard. This waist of space is even more painful if you use  your screen vertically.

Two options to solve this:
* Add a undock button like you did for the brand new 6.0 issue navigator
* Give an option to completely hide the sidebar, since you can access your different dashboards from the pulldown menu (the sidebar is redundant with the menu and not really needed).
fields.summary: Make dashboard sidebar undock-able or remove sidebar totally

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32711].
  {panel}

After performing some tests, we could confirm on the following behavior when it comes to *Dashboard* sharing:
* As Project Lead, the user is not able to share a Dashboard that he / she owns to the specific roles within his / her own project.
* As Project Lead and with the role of Project Administrator, the user is only able to share the Dashboard that he / she owns to other Project Administrators, not to other roles within his / her own project.

This is true as you are only able to share the dashboards / filters only to the role(s) that you belong to. If you want to share it with all the project role(s), ensure yourself included in *ALL* the roles. Just because you are in the *JIRA Administrators* group, it doesn't entitle you to have the ability to share the dashboard / filters to other roles. *JIRA System Administrator* should have that power since they control the whole *JIRA* itself.

However, here is the users explanation on how this issue should be looked at, from a different perspective:
{quote}
My view on a project lead is that he/she should be able to decide the accessibility of info freely within his/hers project to any level of project members without having to be involved into the deepest levels of the project. He/she should be able to sure that work is progressed/done according to the original plan. Project lead IS the utter responsible of the success of the project and should be able to give resources to the project members without any further settings but to be set as project lead.

Of course there might be some security issues which comes with this but they are at the most very remote and dependent on other settings in that case.

Of course getting the project lead level should not override other permission levels. Better safe than sorry.
{quote}

Any thoughts on this? Perhaps this can be considered in the future release of *JIRA*?
fields.summary: Project Lead limitation on Dashboard Sharing

fields.description: One of our Project's JIRA issue sequencing has gone crazy.  This is one of our smallest Project with about 156 issues, yet now every time we try and create an issue is assigning new numbers in the thousands (ex:  1149, 2259, 3349, etc.).  I suspect that we will need to get into the database to reset the sequence accordingly, but need your direction before going into a Production JIRA to change the database.
fields.summary: Jira Project Issue Sequence Number is Incorrect
Application Link to Confluence should fall back to Anonymous to attempt access if access is denied
JQL Filter - Search & Replace
Place Tempo Log Work button on top buttons bar in issue view

fields.description:
Currently,after the end of a phrase/sentence/word in a text field, if any spaces (empty space) is inserted, it will be trimmed and removed.

It also occurs if there is more than one space placed in between words. For example, if there are 3 empty spaces between 2 words, then once it is saved, it would be trimmed into only one space.

Example: * describes the space character.

This is an **** example sentence -> what I write

This is an * example sentence -> what jira does
fields.summary: Cannot use the spaces character between a text/sentence etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32702].
  {panel}

After the removal of a project on JIRA, the project is not being automatically removed from Bamboo. If the new project has the same project key, the project name is not being updated too.

Steps to reproduce:
1.Create a project in JIRA (TEST)
2.This project will appear in project selection when creating a new Plan in Bamboo.
3.Delete TEST from JIRA and create a new project "New Test", with same project key (TEST)
4. Try to create a new plan, the old name will remains, because Bamboo is not checking the project name or bringing it from JIRA.
fields.summary: OnDemand isn't properly removing/updating the projects in Bamboo after JIRA Project removal.

fields.summary: Unable to move my bugs description or comments from bugzilla to JIRA.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32699].
  {panel}

1) Install JIRA standalone by unzipping it into a directory.
2) Run config.bat / config.sh and set the JIRA Home directory and database.. Save and exit.
3) Start JIRA.

It jumps straight to step 2 of the setup wizard, skipping the option to pick the server language. 

This is unrelated to the recent 6.0 work to rewrite the setup process and also happens on 5.2.0. I suspect it's been this way since 4.4.
fields.summary: Using config.bat / config.sh to configure JIRA Home/database also skips language selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32697].
  {panel}

At the moment, a user is able to [configure the maximum attachment size|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Configuring+File+Attachments] through JIRA Administration.  There are times when it is convenient to set a limit of the attachment size for a particular project. 

One scenario:
# User can attach a file for a Support Project up to 50MB
# User can only attach file for the Recruitment Project up to 10MB
fields.summary: Allow users to configure the attachment size per project basis

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32696].
  {panel}

As of now, the [Average Age Report|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Average+Age+Report] are configured to take on either a *Project* or a *Saved Filter*.
!average_age.JPG!

Are there any plans on introducing an option to "exclude" weekends / non-working days? Perhaps something like the button in the *GreenHopper* Burndown Chart?
!burndown_chart.JPG!
fields.summary: Average Age Report to exclude weekend / non-working days

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32695].
  {panel}

As companies grow in both projects and people administration teams must grow to service business needs, however giving full administration access can lead to configuration accidents or general loss of control for they system.

Many complex web applications have the ability of creating roles in order to assign different sets of permissions.

For example, just because I want someone to be able to create new projects it doesn't mean I want him to be able to change the user directory configuration or be able to install plugins.

An easy (and good enough) implementation would be to just hide administration sections per role created.

Having the ability to define roles would allow me to say, for example:

- System administrator: Full access
- Administrator: Access to workflows, permisions & issue level security, custom fields, screens, projects, etc. This role wont have access to System or Plugins settings, but will have access to Projects, Users and and Issues. However, no access to User Directories
- Project administrator: Access to Users (but not User Directories) and Projects

Having the option to only give full access or none affects our decision as a company whether to or not to fully move to Jira: we already have it in our organization but it is only being used in some geographical locations. 

Some teams currently use Assembla or other tools just because they cannot get the access they need from the Jira administrators. Much of this has to do with the inability to create workflows and custom fields. IT doesn't want to give access to everybody for obvious security reasons and that our Jira instance is a big production system, and any disruption of service that may be cause due to a misconfiguration can lead to business disruption or even downtime.
fields.summary: RBAC for granular control of administration section

fields.description: I would like to be able to set the default issue security setting that will be set when issues are added to the system. Currently the issue are being added as a reporter set to my account and anyone can see the issues unless I manually set them to a higher setting.
fields.summary: Issue Collection Default Security Setting

fields.description:
Basically when customer install new JIRA, in JIRA Setup page when it comes to the *Specify Your License Key* page, customer is not able to enter the license when select *I have a license* option since there are no License text field available. Refer to below screenshot:

!no_field_to_enter_license.JPG!


(!) Note: This problem mostly happen when installing JIRA *64-bit*. *This problem is not reproducible* from our end, however there is a high number of issues that reported by customer that is facing the same problem.

*Steps that we advice to customer:*
* Refresh the internet browser page
* Clear internet browser cache
* Restart JIRA
* Try other internet browser

Usually it solved the problem. However, customer hope that we would able to provide a permanent solution on this matter.
fields.summary: In JIRA setup page cannot enter license key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32675].
  {panel}

Issues can only be part of one project. New Feature Request to allow an issue to appear in more than one project.

Because an issue in my industry (semiconductor manufacturing) involves several different disciplines, a single issue during its life cycle may involve several projects, and there is no clear single project where the issue belongs.

We only have the choice of moving an issue from one project to another, or cloning the issue from one project to another.

Moving is of some use since the issue numbering is permanent: if FOO-1 is moved to BAR-9, then subsequent access to FOO-1 will be forwarded to the issue BAR-9. But the FOO-1 issue no longer appears when browsing or searching the FOO project.

The other alternative is cloning; this has been very problematic for us since they are independent copies in multiple projects, and when we update an issue and add comments/attachments, they don't appear in the copy.

In addition to moving and cloning, it would be helpful to have an option to "shadow" an issue into multiple projects, so the issue has an issue number in all projects, and can be browsed/searched in all projects, but adding/modifying the issue in any of those projects will be seen in any other project. (I guess kind of like a hard link in an OS.)
fields.summary: allow an issue to be shadowed in more than one project

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32658].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate*

# Create a test project
# Create version ('v1.0' for example)
# Create an issue in your test project and enter 'v1.0' in the fixversion field. Don't select the autocomplete option, just click anywhere else on the screen
# Hit Create Issue

*Result:*

Error is thrown with message 

{quote}
'Version with id 'v1.0' does not exist. 
{quote}

This happens despite the content being highlighted as if it completed successfully.

*Expected Result*

Issue is created successfully

Issue is not browser specific, happens in current versions of Firefox, Chrome and Safari

fields.summary: OOME in JIRA when viewing a specific issue. Cause currently unknown.
Have the ability to send Account Created notifications email and User invitations as text

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 - create a ticket, and begin editing the description field or begin editing one that already exists
 - make a bunch of edits
 - do @some-name until the auto-popup appears, suggesting a few names
 - press ESC

Expected results:
 - the popup should close

Actual results:
 - the edit box closes and the popup stays popped up.
 - my edits are gone!
fields.summary: Pressing ESC in People chooser of edit issue closes edit box, wiping out changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32653].
  {panel}

The documentation on Advanced Searching has a dead link:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching

When you click on the *linkedIssues()* function, it doesn't take you anywhere:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-linkedIssues

Thanks!

Clarissa
fields.summary: Please edit the documentation on Advanced Searching
Add to mail handler the capability of transition an issue
Add a 'page navigator' control to the bottom of the user picker popup window

fields.description: See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: longer participant names not wrapped
Replace the Contact JIRA Administrators form with Issue Collector form

fields.description:
I want to use the trial version I downloaded to my PC to test Jelly scripts and data imports.
Can I use the same license key for the license we bought?
Also, if I ask to renew the 30 day license it tells me the user name and password are incorrect .. so how can I reset those.
Thanks
fields.summary: Trial version access
Include a Post Function to move issue into current Sprint in Greenhopper
Allow Two Dimensional Filter to use the custom field "Epic Links"

fields.description:
I'm not sure if this is on purpose or by mistake and I got to say that it isn't a big deal, but can be a patience breaker.

Clicking wheel button (opens link on new tab) does open a new tab but at the same time it opens the link in the actual tab too.

fields.description: I am doing test for upgrading JIRA from 4.4 to 5.2. To setup test server with the same setting and data, I tried to import backup xml from prod. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32637].
  {panel}

We've had a couple of users set up subscriptions for certain filters that would be returning less than 100 issues.
The subscription was for all logged-in users, and the filter did use the currentUser() function to generate user specific filter results.
The subscription runs once a week, and when it does, it can cause mail backups for over 2 hours.

So it would be great if one of two things were improved to help us with this:
# Have an automatic equivalent to the "Bypass currently sending mail" if any mail is taking more than a user defined period of time to send, say 5 minutes (or possibly just use the users existing mail queue flush period)
# Move the mail queue to be a non-blocking model, where one stuck mail doesn't prevent the mail behind it from being sent.
fields.summary: Automatically trigger mail bypass if a mail is "Sending" for more than x minutes or make mail queue non-blocking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32636].
  {panel}

Many times in the comments of a JIRA issue I have to make a reference to the commit that was causing the bug, for reference.
I use GIT, so I locate the commit using git command line and get a SHA1. Adding the SHA1 to the comment is not very helpful. Others will need to copy the text and then go to git to locate the commit.
Copying the entire commit log with source code and pasting it to the comment is helpful for readers but makes the comment very large and does not help when investigating previous/following commits. 

I would like to be able to easily embed a commit into a JIRA comment, using a wiki markup like FISHEYE:12ca45f, so that the commit can be read entirely in the JIRA issue comment and that links to the commit in Fisheye, like in this screenshot
!jiracom.png!
fields.summary: Ability to embed FishEye commits to JIRA comments

fields.description:
Example:

{code}- Hey guys http://google.com -
-Hey guys http://google.com -
- Hey guys http://google.com-
-Hey guys http://google.com-
-Hey guys http://google.com a-{code}

Results:

- Hey guys http://google.com -
-Hey guys http://google.com -
- Hey guys http://google.com-
-Hey guys http://google.com-
-Hey guys http://google.com a-

Workaround:
Surround links with \[square brackets\] to achieve this effect:
bq. \-Hey guys \[http://google.com\]\-
-Hey guys [http://google.com]-

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32623].
  {panel}

We would like a custom field that lets you insert a list (as the options for the custom field, like a select list), that has the autocomplete renderer of the User Picker and also have the ability to import, from a csv, the items on the "Edit Options" screen. It would work like a list that has a number of items. If I could 'import' that list, that would be awesome!

- additional concepts to consider:
-- using the import for a field that already has items in the list;
--# need options for "Replace All", "Replace Duplicates", "Skip Duplicates", "Append All", etc...
--# or just make the import avail on the initial creation of the field...

*Benefits/Priority*

Part 1 is truly the most important, since that is the part that makes the U/I more user friendly in dealing with such a huge list.

Part 2 obviously is a back-end/sysadmin benefit in managing the list.
fields.summary: New field type request (list with autocomplete renderer)

fields.description:
If an user has a big number of repositories in Fisheye (for example 60 repositories) and uses workflow transition conditions inside JIRA ("No open review"s and "No Unreviewed Changesets" for example) the transition will timeout. We need to make this process faster.


h5. Workaround

Increasing the timeout value of _atlassian-jira/includes/js/ajs/smartajax.js_ file will do as a workaround (the default value specifies a timeout of 60000ms. Increase this value).
fields.summary: JIRA Timeouts when the workflow transition has to search for a big number of repositories in Fisheye

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*:
# Create a project with notification scheme.
# Set the *Issue Assigned* to *Current Assignee*. Make sure in the notification scheme, only Issue Assigned is triggered when the issue is assigned (you can clear Issue Updated event since is triggered when the issue is assigned).
# Assign the issue to anyone using 'Inline Assign' *NOT* using the 'Assign' button.


*Actual Results*
Emails are not sent.


*Expected Results*
JIRA should send out the email notifications in the same way using the 'Assign' button.
fields.summary: Issue Assigned event is not sending emails using 'Inline Assign'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32617].
  {panel}

Sometimes when the JIRA server restarts automatically, JIRA fails to restart automatically (running via service).

This can leave the application down for some time until an admin is notified or notices the problem.

It would be great if JIRA could send an e-mail to the admins when it fails to start.

Since the start failure can happen before JIRA connects to the database itself, the mail server and contact information will not be available, so maybe some "emergency information" like that could be copied to a separate file which JIRA could access even without database connection.
fields.summary: JIRA to send a mail when it fails to start
Provide ability to style issue collectors

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm using JIRA 5.1.6 + GH 6.1.6. The issue I'm encountering is that if I access a Rapid Board's planning mode and try to click on a "View in issue navigator" link I'm taken to this "Kick-ass" search page that displays some issues though they don't have anything to do with the issues that should in fact be there. In the upper right I have the "take me back to the old navigator" link though clicking on it I'm taken to the normal issue navigator (but again no sign of the issues I'm interested in).

This for sure seems like a bug or a half-baked feature so could you please have a look at this?

Thanks,
Petru
fields.summary: Kick-ass search not so kick-ass
Issue Navigator status column sorting order

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email?focusedCommentId=338365075#comment-338365075

The item in bold below no longer works in Jira 5.2 


h3.Default Reporter	
Specify the username of a default reporter, which will be used if the email address in the From: field of any received messages does not match the address associated with that of an existing JIRA user — for example, a JIRA username such as emailed-reporter 

 Note:

This option is not available if the Create Users check box is selected.
Please ensure that the user specified in this field has the Create I ssues  project permission for the relevantProject (specified above) as well as the Create Comments   project permission for the other relevant projects to which this mail handler should add comments.
*When an issue is created and this option is specified, the email message's From: field address is appended in a brief message at the end of the issue's Description field, so that the sender can be identified.*
fields.summary: Jira "create issues and comments from emails" mail handler no longer appends the FROM address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

During JIRA startup it executes DB configuration - this is reporting as OK using a MySQL DB with a schema when it's not OK.

h3. Environment

* Ubuntu.
* MySQL 5.1.41.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install a version of JIRA that is not the latest using MySQL.
# Stop it.
# Add a schema to the {{dbconfig.xml}}, e.g.:
{code:XML}
<schema-name>jiradb</schema-name>
{code}
# Upgrade it to the latest version.
# Start JIRA.

h3. Expected Results

It notifies the user of an error in the log files that the MySQL configuration is incorrect and requires fixing.

h3. Actual Results

It reports as OK, even though it's not:

{noformat}
2013-04-15 13:29:30,665 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "Worklog" has no table in the database
2013-04-15 13:29:30,666 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create table "jiradb.worklog"
2013-04-15 13:29:30,666 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE TABLE jiradb.worklog (ID DECIMAL(18,0) NOT NULL, issueid DECIMAL(18,0), AUTHOR VARCHAR(255), grouplevel VARCHAR(255), rolelevel DECIMAL(18,0), worklogbody LONGTEXT, CREATED DATETIME, UPDATEAUTHOR VARCHAR(255), UPDATED DATETIME, STARTDATE DATETIME, timeworked DECIMAL(18,0), CONSTRAINT PK_worklog PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Table 'worklog' already exists
2013-04-15 13:29:31,103 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "ApplicationUser"
2013-04-15 13:29:31,355 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "DraftWorkflowScheme"
2013-04-15 13:29:31,614 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "DraftWorkflowSchemeEntity"
2013-04-15 13:29:31,874 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "Feature"
2013-04-15 13:29:32,133 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Created declared indices for entity "ManagedConfigurationItem"
2013-04-15 13:29:32,527 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.DatabaseChecklistLauncher] JIRA database startup checks completed successfully.
2013-04-15 13:29:32,528 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl] Now running Post database-configuration launchers
2013-04-15 13:29:33,251 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [jira.config.database.SystemTenantDatabaseConfigurationLoader] Reading database configuration from /var/atlassian/application-data/jira/dbconfig.xml
2013-04-15 13:29:33,849 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.DatabaseLauncher] Database transactions enabled: true
2013-04-15 13:29:33,850 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.DatabaseLauncher] Using JIRA's default for database transaction isolation level: 2
2013-04-15 13:29:33,852 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] 

Database configuration OK

___ Database Configuration _________________

     Loading entityengine.xml from                 : file:/opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entityengine.xml
     Entity model field type name                  : mysql
     Entity model schema name                      : jiradb
     Database Version                              : MySQL - 5.1.41-3ubuntu12.8
     Database Driver                               : MySQL-AB JDBC Driver - mysql-connector-java-5.1.10 ( Revision: ${svn.Revision} )
     Database URL                                  : jdbc:mysql://allurbase:3306/jiradb?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB
     Database JDBC config                          : mysql jdbc:mysql://allurbase:3306/jiradb?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB

2013-04-15 13:29:35,695 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] 
{noformat}

h3. Notes

This can lead to a failed upgrade as the DB cannot create the new columns that the auto-export functionality expects to be there, as per a previous bug, JRA-28526.

h3. Workaround

Remove the invalid schema element {{<schema-name>...</schema-name>}} in {{dbconfig.xml}}.
fields.summary: Database configuration incorrectly reports as OK for a MySQL DB where a schema is set.

fields.description:
1. Create a new custom field using admin functions.  In this example, the field that allows users to enter in a line of text.
2. Enter the edit mode, and then type in a short sentence.
3. Save it all into a screen config, then apply it to a project.
4. Go back into edit mode, then change the text.
5. Save it, then go back and view the results on the screen during usage.

Results: The text remains the same, even though in edit mode it appeared to recognize the changes.
fields.summary: Description text in custom-made fields do not update on field screens when modified.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32587].
  {panel}

Also affects the notification helper plugin.

Urls are locale-indepedent resources and *should not* be i18n resources. 

This creates confusion for translators and allows the possibility of completely breaking JIRA by just using a language pack which has a bad url.

This has happened in the past where the application links project had this same type of bug and translators at translations.atlassian.com _translated_ the url into something that resembled their language.
fields.summary: Jira Administration Helper Plugin uses i18n resources to store URLs
